intro: Chionohebe, commonly known as the silver bell, is a genus of flowering plants native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plants typically grow as shrubs or subshrubs, with silver-gray foliage that adds to their ornamental appeal. Chionohebe species are often found in coastal and forested areas, thriving in well-drained soils. They are valued in horticulture for their attractive blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions.
